√âvaluation publi√©e le 10 juillet 2023
As long as you have enough space somewhere in your room I highly recommend this game. This uses VR as no other game I've played. Yes you can be in a jungle with dinosaurs or shoot some zombies in others, but this one is very immersive. Who did not want to be like Indiana Johns, right?

The game is not too long and might require some rearagement of fernitures in the living room (it does for me!), but definitelly worth trying.

Personne n'a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
0.7 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 14 mars 2023
Even if I probably won't continue playing Eye of the Temple, I'm recommending it.

This is because the game is brilliant - I just don't like the slow pace.
While I was playing, I was absolutely amazed by how well the concept works and how much thought (and work) was obviously put into this. Several times I took of my Valve Index to see how badly entangled the cable was (I'm using a pulley cable management system), but it just wasn't!

But as I said, the pace is too slow for me. I like fast movement in VR like running, jumping, flying, etc. But here you're "forced" to take your route step by step, which is too tedious for me personally.
Still I think that this game is a must-try, as it's super unique and very well implemented!

Broocevelt
0
1 personne a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
4.4 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 22 janvier 2023
Cool game!
Get it for the innovative movement mechanics if you have the play space and VR legs for it.
The story is light, puzzle elements are on the easy side and the story takes about 4 hours.

Verdict:
I liked the game.
Would've been nice to have a deeper story and it felt a bit tedious at times, especially when I had to backtrack to fix something I didn't figure out early on how to activate.

I absolutely love innovation and this game has the innovative movement mechanic where you traverse the world only by moving in real life, so there's no stick or teleport movement. Although the concept of moving by stepping from moving platform to moving platform is brilliant, I would've liked it be mixed up with more normal walking in the play space. Maybe explore balancing on beams more over lava or heights while being attacked or dodging swinging obstacles. Would've also been cool to fly over the temple area using something like a zipline or even a hang-glider where you need to steer by shimmying from side to side while hanging on to a horizontal bar. I'm sure ideas like this must have popped up during development but didn't fit the budget.

Really hoping the future brings more games where real world movement is used.
So far I've come across these:
* Eye of the Temple
* Tea for God
* Spellbound Spire
* S√∂mmad (1 level so it's more like a tech demo)

------------------------------------------------
Story:
The story is quite simple. As you play, you learn the history of what has happened and what your part in the story is and how the story will end. Still you want to experience that ending, explore the world and beat the game, so I guess the story is sufficient to give context to the world you are in and adds a bit to the motivation for progressing.

Puzzles:
The puzzles are rather simple and revolve around which path to take or which levers to pull to be able to get to a certain place. I didn't need a walk-through guide to complete the game.

World:
They managed to make the areas of the temple feel different. Some areas have lava, water, pits, spikes, flame and high drops which makes it feel like you're exploring new areas and progressing.

Game length:
It took me a little over 4 hours to complete. After completion I had 56% of the achievements so the game would be longer if you are an achievement hunter. There's also a speedrun mode where the game keeps speeding up if you're fast at switching platforms. This can be used as a workout session and also has global leaderboards. I think it's pretty neat but I don't think a lot of players have tried it since I reached 20th place on my first try.

As for the story mode I think the length was just right. If it had been longer there would need to be more variety in gameplay or more excitement and depth to the story.

Backtracking annoyance:
I had to backtrack some areas to activate an artifact, which I didn't know how to activate at first. Backtracking is never fun, but they made it a easier to find and get to these artifacts later in the game by using a device that helps you see the missing artifacts through walls and also the mine cart helps you travel quickly around the area. It also helps see that you pick up red gems as you move around so if you don't see a trail of gems, you've taken that path before.
 
supersmo
814 produits enregistr√©s
0
Personne n'a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
5.1 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 18 janvier 2023
As a VR veteran from the first month I have seen many good things over the years. This game was a welcome and impressive surprise!
It looks simple but comes with an unique and creative concept (super smart locomotion), wrapped in a nice setting (Tomb Raider/ Indiana Jones etc.) and is unfolded in a good pace (not too hard, always something new till the end). Depending on your puzzle solving skills and urge to explore all corners, the main story is about 4-6 hours but not boring or unnecessary stretched in return. I have not encountered a single bug, so its fleshed out. I can recommend it for the full price because its fun and unique like ‚ÄúA Fisherman‚Äôs Tale‚Äù or ‚ÄúMoss‚Äù.

If you have big issues with heights you will face a big challenge. You need at least 2x2m space, must never jump, and should start slowly to get used to the concept. Best played with a wireless headset. Hence (and because of the simpler graphics) I see it well fitting in the Quest/Vive/Pico-universe. Done by a single developer!? Impressive and respect!
 
PioneerRun
0
Personne n'a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
0.9 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 9 janvier 2023
Very nice and polished VR experience, but not for beginners. I myself nearly fell over a few at the beginning until I got my head around how to deal with the accelleration of the plattforms. My girlfriend involuntarily did the splits and is currently healing her strain - not bad and party her own fault, but it happened despite her VR experience with other titles.
Tip: Start slowly, don't rush and be focussed at start. The game takes up quite a bit of space as you progress on moving platforms, but they are cleverly positioned so you're never far from your starting position. I recommend an area of ‚Äã‚Äãabout 3x3m for safe gameplay. I played the free demo ("first steps") first and unfortunately the savegame is not being transferred to the paid version.

Too bad it's not a very long game, I'm hoping for a sequel. I can fully recommend this game, well done game developer!

Indiana Jones Simulator VR
This game is made for mixed reality and absolutely cool. Balancing on the barrels make you feel a bit woozy sometimes, but overall its good in terms of motion sickness. The riddles are challenging and the map is HUGE. The whip is sometimes a bit tricky to execute, but still everything works well and is managable.
Works well with Oculus Quest 2.

Personne n'a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
3.6 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 4 septembre 2022
I Dont write reviews often but ,.. i just felt the need to add my 2 cents on this gem of a VR game!
for anyone that enjoys puzzle games and / or VR .. i HIGHLY recommend giving this game a go .. REAL actual movement is needed, no teleport movement, so.. if you have about 3 steps in any direction you can take from center of your play space, you have enough room. (my space is about 7.5 ft x 7.5ft) ... and the level design is so brilliant it keeps you within your space.
That being said: if your wired, and its not suspended,... you do have to be careful of where your wire is as you sometimes have to make some quick steps but its honestly the most fun, and some of the best "use" ive experienced in VR .... GREAT JOB!!
 
{Some-Jerk}
0
1 personne a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
8.7 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 6 aout 2022
All I can say is wow. My family has been gaming since the first atari pong. When I say family, it started with my mom. She loved platform games like no other. This is a mix of plat former and tomb raider where you are immensely put in to the game. I am glad it is a pcvr game as I am a game collector and steam makes it so much easier to collect and extend the life of games. With that said, if this was released to be able to play on the quest 2 naitively, I think it would be a instant hit for young and old. The one person developer truly was a gamer from the past and brought it to the VR. Once I got comfortable knowing that the precise stepping and walking mechanics simply worked and kept you in your 6ft x 6ft play area freely lashing out with your whip, ducking, moving up and down, stepping and seemingly walking, climbing and having a sensation of needing to maintain your balance. Just unreal. Good show. I have not defeated the game yet but I will. I see potential of more titles to come with this experience and maybe a co-op version because games were not meant to be played alone. Ready Player One. Which is very true! One other thing I don't write a lot of reviews but when I do its for good reason.

176 produits enregistr√©s
0
Personne n'a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
4.3 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 31 juillet 2022
Unique VR room-scale "platformer" with huge open levels, casual puzzles and extremely satisfying movement and whip usage.

Room-scale locomotion is one of the most immersive things in VR that makes virtual places feel very real. And here it is used with full force, while requiring only 2m x 2m play space. Rolling blocks are great idea that enables player to traverse long distances on foot without any space warping or "changing room around the corner" tricks. Which in turn allows Eye of the Temple to have giant open levels, where other room-scale games have to do with series of small rooms.
 
RagingPoet
633 produits enregistr√©s
0
Personne n'a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
5.3 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 29 juin 2022
The locomotion in this game is one of a kind.

The only caveat that I have with it is that if you are 6 feet tall and over, than be prepared to have a stiff neck since you'll be looking down a lot.

Otherwise, the game is a solid 8/10.

√âvaluation publi√©e le 20 mai 2022
Eye of the Temple stands out from other VR games with its unique movement mechanic. While I really do wish the game was a bit longer with a higher level of challenge, this game is worth it for the novelty alone, and I thoroughly enjoyed my time with it. I wish more VR developers would design for actual roomscale spaces like this!

813 produits enregistr√©s
0
1 personne a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
4.1 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 16 mai 2022
Raiding a Tomb in VR.

Graphics/Performance

This game works under Proton/Linux but gets very laggy in some areas. I was still able to complete the game through the lag. Most areas have a decent frame rate. Ran using an RTX 3090.

Gameplay

This game is really well thought out. You play the whole thing without needing any button presses or joystick input from the VR controllers. Just full motion controls and using your body to move around in your playspace. Even minor things like focusing your attention using a ball of light to look or move into a reset position are well thought out. The vibration of the whip and the feedback when your controller hits a wall/obstacle is really immersive.

Sound

Music fits the theme of jungle tomb raiding. Voice actress for the narrator is okay.

Final Thoughts

There's not many well polished VR titles that have a decent playtime and a satisfying ending. The story is vanilla but the puzzles and platforming are what kept me invested. It's a novel use of your playspace and if you have the room, I highly recommend this one.

2 thumb up.
 
Nanopino
0
1 personne a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
5.7 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 15 mai 2022
The game is built around the core mechanic of walking backwards in real life to move forward in-game, using a rolling drum. This is a very novel approach and allows for the illusion of infinite space. This mostly works well, but you don't always take the exact same amount of steps, so there is still a little off-center drifting that occurs. My playspace is 3.5x5m and I found myself triggering the boundaries a few times. This is not a big deal, but it does break the immersion.

It feels a little clinical (heavy on math, light on story), but I think it fits the theme. I'd love to see the same mechanics used in a more story-driven game, as a means of locomotion only, rather than the star of the whole show.

Well worth your time and money, but I'd suggest ample playspace and a wireless headset to really get the best experience from it. I played this game all the way through on my Focus 3 and experienced zero bugs or glitches. It's polished and well made.

8,5/10.

√âvaluation publi√©e le 10 mai 2022
Game is really good, but it is giving me a headache üò≠

UPD: I just had to get used to it. In the end, game is very enjoyable. Not perfect, it may be kinda repetative occasionally, and my room is kinda too small to play it comfortably without constantly seeing blue walls, and a whip a little bit too short (which becomes really apparent in final boss fight), but just as a concept, it is really well-designed, and I say that it is worth to try

Also, it is so surprising of how much of our balance sense is controlled by our visuals. You really start to lose balance when you step on a moving platform

√âvaluation publi√©e le 23 f√©vrier 2022
What a great concept for VR! Follows a bit in the foot-steps of the few games (e.g. Tea for God) that are serious about using the position of the player in VR (making the experience so much more immersive). The dynamics in this game are novel and overall creates a very polished experience. Not extremely hard, but a fun puzzle challenge and awesome game dynamic overall. Bravo & keep games like this coming!

1 personne a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
6.8 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 22 f√©vrier 2022
UPDATE STARTS After playing through a few more levels of this game, I felt the need to update my review.

I'm what you call a mature gamer, with well over 5,000 hours of gaming and I can honestly say that Eye of the Temple is in my Top 5 gaming experiences of all time, maybe even the best gaming experience I have ever enjoyed...


UPDATE ENDS

Played 100's of VR games for many years, and THIS game got me excited about VR again.

The limiting factor of VR is that you are constrained to your physical environment and it doesn't matter how games try get around that, you are pretty much always aware that you are in your room - for the fear of running into or punching a wall - UNTIL NOW.

This game mechanic is next level room scale. It actually means that you can literally feel as if you are traversing huge areas, while in actuality, you are only walking around a 2m play space. It is absolutely genius. A very few number of other games have tried similar things, but not on such a grand scale, or with such amazing effect.

I really hope this game gets the success it deserves and motivates the developer to take this to another level. I'd love to see more of this type of game, perhaps a darker more sinister theme, or a slightly less "floating block" environment that was more believable.

I did not believe a new VR game, in my old Vive Pro headset, in my same 2m play space, would evoke such new wonders at this stage in my VR experience.

Thank you so much to the developer!
 
Rocky

√âvaluation publi√©e le 13 f√©vrier 2022
It‚Äôs been a long time since I‚Äôve played a game or experience in VR which has given me that huge wow factor partly because I‚Äôve been playing VR for such a long time now but my mind was absolutely blown with this one! ü§Ø

The game revolves around physically moving about your playspace (you‚Äôll need at least 2m by 2m) onto moving platforms around this huge temple where you‚Äôre solving various puzzles. You‚Äôre armed with a torch to light fire (which aids with the puzzle solving) as well as a whip to wrap around levers. Makes you feel extremely immersed and a bit like Indiana Jones in VR!

I played it wirelessly over oculus airlink using the quest 2 and because of the requirement to physically move on to platforms in the game, it works extremely well with the quest!

Would be amazing for the developer of this to one day bring it to quest natively without the need for a PC because the style of the game suits the wireless nature of the headset so well! Incredible title and I‚Äôd recommend to anybody!

1 personne a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile

Recommand√©
4.2 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 2 f√©vrier 2022
Really cool exploration experience. The puzzles are not challenging. It's really satisfying to make it through each area. I don't know of another game that uses room scale movement like this, it is very cool.

I have two complaints. The whip sucks to use to pull levers. I don't know why I have so much trouble with it. It's really physics based it seems, just never does what I want.

The wires are a killer. I have to constantly be aware of it and kicking my feet around trying to clear it. It really kills the immersion. There has been more than one occasion where I have stepped on the wire and yanked the headset around my head. I am playing with an Index, I don't have a pulley system.

In the end, those two drawbacks don't change my recommendation. It's such a cool game that every VR owner should pick it up. ESPECIALLY if you're lucky enough to be able to play wireless.
 
hurlman

1.3 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 27 janvier 2022
Produit re√ßu gratuitement

This is a great game.
Disclaimer; I did not pay for the game, but keep reading...
Being a VR expert, I am sent plenty of game codes for testing and giving UX feedback. And in most cases, I don't give public review. But this one is a tour-de-force because the author managed to break soooo many UX rule and dont-do in VR game design and turned it into a great game.
If you have played so many VR games that you feels like "Yes, sure another great explorer-shooter", you have to try this one.
Everything (almost) in the UX / Game design is something you have not seen anywhere else. Displacement, activation, puzzle solving... It's even challeging you in your Real-Wolrd ability to contoll your ballance like you'd do on an IRL Parcour.
It's a fun game to play together with friends and familly, to collaborate on the complex puzzles, to challenge each other on the hard levels.
Go get it !
 
bernard
0
1 personne a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
7.8 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 21 janvier 2022
The roomscale VR is the highlight of this game, (if you have the minimum required space). You walk and turn freely in the world (there is an option for snap turn) by moving onto series of moving platforms, these platforms make it feel like you are traversing really far into the map, but really you're walking in circles in your playspace, while looking like a dork dodging/ducking, rolling (on logs) and cracking your whip.

The addition of a "spectator mode" with various camera controls (3rd person, a few first person options, and different camera behaviors) makes the game fun for more than one person, because if you're taking turns you can watch what the other person is doing, and figure out the puzzles together. There is even a little model of a camera that floats along with you (I think just in 3rd person camera) that reminds you of the presence of what the other person is seeing.

Overall light-puzzles accompanied by movement/timing puzzles, few and light narrative moments, sense of space through roomscale locomotion, and the artstyle make the experience something any VR enthusiast with enough space should try. It's not a crazy wow factor (aside from feeling like friggin Indiana [redacted] tm explorer guy), but it does make you feel that initial charm of trying your first VR headset on again, with the novel roomscale experience. A neat understated gem.
 
jadesded
1

A wonderful, mostly peaceful puzzle game that does roomscale VR right. They're absolutely not kidding about 2x2m being the minimum though.

You definitely want to enable wireless on your VR headset for this, otherwise you can really get tangled up in the cable!

582 produits enregistr√©s
0
2 personnes ont trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
1
Recommand√©
8.5 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 7 janvier 2022
Wow, GET THIS GAME. Even if not on sale. It is like Tomb Raider in VR, but that doesn't even properly describe it. It is awesome!

I had been holding off on this game for a while as I usually wait until games are a bit older and on sale before getting them. But a lot of VR games don't appear on sale as often or as drastically as non-vr games as -understandably- as it is still a growing field and there are a lot of indie VR developers out there who maybe can't afford to do that with their games. However, I decided to jump in on this one after seeing the critical acclaim and it did NOT disappoint.

It seems this is an indie developer, but the level of polish, thought and creativity involved in this game would make you believe it was one of the big studios.

It is kind of mind boggling how much effort was put into creating such an immersive game that has you moving constantly exploring a huge temple without straying far from your VR space. It works SO well. Love, love, love the idea and wish more games had this sort of movement instead of just relying on the joystick. I also like the use of the whip to attack enemies and do other tasks. Very smart.

I think I'm kind of a VR veteran at this stage, having played the vast majority of the well known games, but this one really surprised me as to how fun it is. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!
 
Harbinger Thrace

√âvaluation publi√©e le 13 d√©cembre 2021
An absolutely brilliant implementation of room-scale VR - and a great game. DON'T buy it if you haven't got access to a 2m by 2m space. A free demo is provided so you can check it out before you buy. Explore the hidden temple, whip and torch in hand, avoid the fiendish traps, solve the puzzles and attempt to defeat the darkness! A definite Indiana J. vibe. This is the only game I've played so far where I've got a real sense of acrophobia! Highly recommended.
 
GeeDubyah
0
1 personne a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
8.8 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 7 d√©cembre 2021
I'm new to VR and this game was a great example of what I thought VR should be. It was so immersive I felt myself responding to the environment.. sweating, heart pounding. Using the body is required: ducking, sidestepping, swinging your arm. You definitely need the recommended space and probably a little more since I found myself close to out of bounds from time to time. The movement mechanic is very clever and ties into the story. As for the story, it's fairly generic but works well. At this price point it's well worth your time if you enjoy exploration, temple diving, and solving light puzzles. Many games charge more for price paid per hour gameplay, and this game has secrets to discover as well. I've only played a handful of VR games and this is one of my favorites. I hope to see more like this.
 
isotope
0
1 personne a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
6.2 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 30 novembre 2021
I wrote a review of the demo ages ago - Yes, there is a free demo. Try it. This is an updated version.

Wow. First off, let's say this is a REALLY clever game.

It's the first time I've ever played a VR game that feels like you're actually physically moving in infinite space, where the clever level design means that you're really moving within your confined play area without realising it. You have to try it to truly appreciate it. I'm 6+ months on from having played the demo, and nothing else I've tried feels as real as this.

The demo seemed very polished - there are full games out there with far more sharp edges. The full version is just as nice - just bigger. The graphics are great, and the sound spot on. All together hugely immersive.

One small thing; this is best played with a pulley system (or something keeping the cable out of your way). Otherwise, when you step forwards onto a roller, and then shuffle backwards (you'll see what I mean you when try it), there is every chance you'll end up stepping on your cable. The constant need to monitor where the cable is will hurt the immersion that this game works so hard to build up.

If you have a 2mx2m or larger roomscale playspace, then you owe it to yourself to try this out! If you don't, just burn your furniture until you do!
 
Robin

I finished the boss. Now I'm trying to find the hidden secrets.

0
3 personnes ont trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
1.5 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 30 novembre 2021
Between pcvr(Steam and Oculus)and the Quest 2, I can't even guess how many VR games I've bought since mid 2016, and I'm not even counting the dozens and dozens of titles I had on my PlayStation VR before it broke. All that being said, I very rarely feel the need to review a game, but I'll make an exception for this. I think it was with the release of Saints and Sinners that I first started to see some decent physics in vr games. I know that it's what Boneworks is known for (though I haven't played that one yet)Those physics were the last big gameplay innovation introduced to VR that I know of, until now. There are other roomscale experiences, but not with this kind of movement system and this level of polish. This is truly innovative. I've never been this immersed in an experience. I find having to use analog sticks to move in other games to be immersion breaking now. I love, love, love showing this off to friends. Even friends that have been somewhat lukewarm about VR in general, are absolutely blown away by this. Amazing job from this developer. I'm hoping for some dlc for this, but I'm even more excited about what this developer will come up with next. Once again, out-friggin-standing!

Personne n'a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
0.3 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 28 novembre 2021
This is a great game ! The whip motion is great and the game is totally roomscale ! **Beware the 2mx2m is a must** it was a little too small for me, I have maybe 1.5x1.5 and it was not enjoyable as i was walking in everything in my room, but otherwise, its a very fun game ! The roller however... I get it, as you move, u walk backward to your centerspace but it is a bit motion sickening. Ive been in VR since 2017 and nothing make me feel weird anymore... I can go full speed in any game without any comfort option for hours BUT the roller still fell very weird, at first. Nothing you cant overcome as this kind of dizziness pass so dont skip on this game because of this, but it still got me by surprise. Great game overall, as soon as I get a little more space, i will enjoy it !

One of the most immersive VR games I've played - and by far the one with the most intelligent movement concept. The only small drawback is that you definitely need at least 2x2m of free space (2.5m is better). However, I've gotten by with just 2x2m without bumping into anything too hard, hitting walls/desk/cabinet, or stepping on a cat.

If you've ever dreamed of being Indiana Jones (from the old movies), this is the game for you!

1.1 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 24 novembre 2021
Eye of the Temple is a platform / exploration game where you have to physically move in a 2x2m space, thanks to an innovative level design the game keeps you in that space and always make you go back to the center of the play area without you realizing.
The game itself puts you in the pants of an adventurer, Indiana Jones or Lara Croft style, with a torch and a whip and you have to find your way towards the inside of the temple by navigating moving platforms, playing with levers, avoiding deadly traps. One of the good VR surprise this year !

3.9 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 22 novembre 2021
This is an incredibly fun puzzle game that will immerse you in the feeling of exploring a ruined mountain temple. One of the best VR games I've played. One nother review said you don't really need 2mx2m. I have 2mx2m exactly, and I broke something getting overexcited with my whip. I think you absolutely need 2x2, and make sure you have your chaperone walls up. I set them to a sort of burnt orange color, and then it is not too obtrusive with this game's color palette.

If you have the space, get this game. If you don't have the space, buy a new house just so you can play this game.

√âvaluation publi√©e le 6 novembre 2021
Wonderful use of VR. Runs well, no particular bugs either. Puzzles are sort of surprising, autopiloting them doesn't usually work but instead you will have to think things out a bit.

Played on HP Reverb G2 headset. Works fine for that one. Having good cable management / hanging system is probably mandatory because of all the hopping around.
 
Kaitsuh
0
1 personne a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
4.8 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 5 novembre 2021
A VR must play for everyone with a big enough space.

The whip and torch were great and I enjoyed the "progression" of your items getting better throughout the game (i won't spoil here). Definitely could use a left-hand mode; whipping was pretty difficult with my non-dominant hand!

Really enjoyed the puzzles and variety the game offers. Falling ceilings, the white tiles that move forward so you gotta dodge everything, the crushing pillars you have to time with the whip lever, etc.. the game doesn't get stale.

Final boss was challenging and great- like the old days where game mechanics you've already learned help you take him down. It was crazy how a little bit of pressure made me fall off a simple roller 2 or 3 times.

The story is not polished even in terms of indie games. The story torches were pretty barebones, voice acting passable but not great, and (without spoiling a lot) the bird at the end was too bright to see any detail. Turn her down! I want to see the textures!

Gameplay is still a solid 10 for innovation and fleshing out the concept.

I'll buy the sequel day one.

 
Un d√©veloppeur ou une d√©veloppeuse a r√©pondu √† cette √©valuation

The textures could also be improved. Overall, I think that it is a game everyone with 2x2m space should try and enjoy. I hope the developer can improve it because it is worth the effort. Thanks for this little jewel and keep pushing.

Es un gran juego para el mundo de la VR. El sistema de movimiento es impresionante. Creo que incluso m√°s inmersivo que Half life alyx. Algunas animaciones no son muy suaves y eso que tengo una 3080ti sin usar al menos el 50%. Las texturas se podr√≠an mejorar. En resumen: creo que es un juego que todo el amante de VR deber√≠a tener (necesario espacio de 2x2m). Espero que el desarrollador pueda mejorarlo porque merece la pena. Gracias por esta peque√±a joya y seguir mejorando.

Recommand√©
6.8 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 26 octobre 2021
For me, this is the 2nd best roomscale game I've played, next to the understandably 1st place Half Life: Alyx.

I enjoyed this game so much, it was well thought out and designed, and certainly challenging enough for me (it took 5.1 hours for me to get through). And I haven't found any of those secrets for extra achievements yet, so I will be having another run through it.

I just found it incredibly immersive, the moving mechanic was unique and yet I felt so free in a world that in reality I was interacting with in 2m x 2m portions! I even got vertigo a few times from the feeling of being high up.

In this game it makes you feel like an Indiana Jones type character, and you'll find you even get his style of hat in-game! And unlike Indy, I didn't need a gun to defeat my foes, just that sturdy whip...

√âvaluation publi√©e le 29 octobre 2021
Wow! So far this game ranks up there for one of the top VR experiences I've had! It requires space to walk (2x2 meters?) in where as I'm pretty sure every other VR game I've ever played I could just stand in one place. It also requires me to turn with my body, not just my head and the controller. Those might sound minor but they make just a huge difference to how immersed it feels. Highly recommended!

I'm glad to see more game with LIV support and using creative locomotion style. That being said, I hope the game level to be shorter, because it get repetitive really quick. Once you learn the basic mechanism of the game, it's just doing everything again and again for 1 hour or more. There's no new puzzles, just walk onto the block and collect red crystals then use them to light up the beacon. It might be OK with flat screen game, but doing that for 1 hour in vr I feel really tedious and exhausted.

0
Personne n'a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
1.4 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 18 octobre 2021
It's certainly a very interesting game. You have to move only with your feet, no virtual movement controls in this game.
Graphic is not the strongest value of this game but pretty much acceptable considering its file size (it's only about 700MB). It feels repeating itself after some time but still have a lot of interesting parts from to time.

I think it's a very unique game but definitely not for PC VR. This game if for Oculus quest, stand alone device, not because of play space but the direction where player face. It requires only 1~2 square meters to play but the direction is 360 degrees. So If you play this game with PC VR, your line of the headset get tangled after some time. I had to pause the game several times to re-spin my body to untangle the line. I'm sure this game will be released for Oculus quest some time soon, so wait to buy it for stand alone device.
 
Red_Go
68 produits enregistr√©s
0
1 personne a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
0.7 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 17 octobre 2021
I gotta say this game is just awesome!

It manages to capture that feel of exploring and trailblazing while playing with my inner child. The use of of platforms makes the game simple yet genius. I love those rolling ones which actually reset your position in your playarea by walking backwards its insanely smart and fun. This is a great design choice overall!

Also the use of those gems is awesome and prevents a lot of motion sickness while proceeding. the way those areas connect with each other is feeling really nice i did enjoy the ride so far.

The only complain, and that is a really really minor one, is the whip which is at times behaving werid despite using 4 tracking stations but its also nothing too crazy tho you can feel it when fighting those beatles in the beginning.

Overall this feels like the embodyment of how a adventure game in VR should look like, i loved the ads and trailers back then and im not dissapointed at all.

Since im playing this game in little dosis (due to beeing sensitive to motion sickness) im gonna play it little by little and cant wait to proceed tomorrow.

Also i barely write any reviews but that games worth my time doing so.

Its a straight 10 / 10 for me.
 
DukeSmile

Personne n'a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
5.7 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 17 octobre 2021
That was awesome...
100% immersion, you are no longer in your room, holding your controllers. you are moving free inside this dangerous, sometimes scary temple. Good riddles, nice background story (not very deep, maybe compulsory, but it drives the expierience well), secrets, minecarts (wohoooo...), nice graphics (it's not AAA-newgen-Cyberpunk-like, but awesome for it's purpose), amazing light-fx, which make dark passages even more oppressive (immagine it's almost pitch-black, you see this shady rockwalls until the next corner, and you have this uncomfortable feeling, that anything could lurk over there in the darkness.)
And traps. there are lots of them. deadly, mean traps.

I think it's almost a steal for this low price.
Hope to see more of this comming...? maybe some extra-content like a dlc, or something? Or even a "eye of the temple II - resurrection of darkness"?

Great Job, dev!
I'm looking forward for more.

Great game, well done on the roomscale locomotion! You get the hang of it quickly and then you are able to traverse large open spaces while only moving within the confined area of your play space (which does need to be large!). Played for 3 hours straight so far and am really enjoying it. Sometimes the whip is a little hard to use, but I‚Äôm getting better at it‚Ä¶I can‚Äôt imagine they are easy to use irl anyway, lol. Only negative so far (which may be by design) is that it is often very hard to backtrack‚Ä¶so if you want to get back somewhere, often your only path is to go completely through an area, even if you‚Äôve already completed it. Very minor complaint though, I am really looking forward to jumping back in and playing further! [Playing on Vive with TP-Cast wireless adapter and Index controllers.]

√âvaluation publi√©e le 16 octobre 2021
Obviously I haven't spent a great deal of time in the game yet and I have no idea how long of an experience in, but this dev deserves support for creating a genius of a game. Feels like I am inside of an old school NES platformer - in a good way. But that is about the feel of the game - the graphics themselves are really really nice. Takes some time to trust your guardian (make sure you draw it accurately) and the game, but once I did I really got into the flow. Great work! Looking forward to playing the rest.

UPDATE: finished the game at just about 6 hours, though did not find any of the secrets yet, so will probably play some more in the coming weeks. Really enjoyable. Difficult definitely scaled well, at least for me. Challenges felt challenging, both in terms of the puzzle nature and physical moves required.

√âvaluation publi√©e le 15 octobre 2021
Eye of the Temple is a brilliant roomscale only game in a world where roomscale games are uncommon. Yes, it requires a 2x2m space to play in, but that isn't much and it's totally worth the effort if you have to clean a room up a bit to get the space. Fun puzzles and a theme that's not often explored are the highlights of this puzzler for me!
 
Gwanatu
0
3 personnes ont trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
5.7 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 15 octobre 2021
One of the best VR experiences I've had! You truly feel like you're Indiana Jones! You do need to a 2x2 meter play area- I had to move around a bunch of furniture in order to have the space to play, but it makes for an incredible & immersive room-scale experience! There is no teleportation or artificial locomotion, which makes it feel much more real. You can however rotate the play space while playing (with the Vive wand you use the trackpad to rotate) which I like.

This is also a mixed reality content creators dream - I don't know how they did it, but the lighting in the game would reflect onto me- I've never seen that before. Major props on that. You can watch my mixed reality gameplay here to see what I'm talking about:
Vid√©o YouTube‚Ñ¢: Become Lara Croft in Eye of the Temple VR! (Mixed Reality Gameplay) 
Vues : 13,866
Finally you can bring your Indiana Jones & Tomb Raider fantasies to life in VR with Eye of the Temple! In Eye of the Temple you explore a vast and treacherous temple in VR using your own feet,...

157 produits enregistr√©s
0
2 personnes ont trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
7.4 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 15 octobre 2021
I knew this game would be awesome from the demo, and I was waiting anxiously for the release... and it did not disappoint (Wow!). Just over an hour into it and I am really impressed, very smooth, great graphics and a sense that I will fall to my death at any moment gets the adrenaline going. My hats off to the developer who has created a very unique experience. Definitely worth knocking down a wall or two in order to get the play space, but 2m x 2m is not unreasonable. So cool that you don't need any buttons on your controller the game is played by movement of feet and hands alone (so cool!).
Not sure if I missed it but my one request is a way to have profiles so that multiple players can save their progress, I have 2 daughters that also love this game and it would be cool if we all could play and then save our progress.
 
robert.mileer

Alright here are some facts and some opinions:
1. If you own and know how to properly use [url=
]OVRAS[/url] then you don't need a 2m x 2m play space. You can use space drag just fine, and play this game sitting in your desk chair. This is what OVRAS is designed to do.; give us 3 legged people an opportunity to play games you normies can play, without it. I use the index, and have my right hand/left hand space drags bound to right/left touch pads and It didn't interfere with the controls at all. If you're one of the cool kids who uses OVRAS in Rec Room, then this will come easily and naturally.
2. The whipping is satisfying. It is rubbery and snappy and most importantly im glad I get to do this in VR versus real life or I'd be covered in lashes by now. And there is a bit of "combat" which surprised me. Unfortunately for the dev, this whipping simply made me want to go whip some bad guys over in Rec Room...
3. ...so yeah...45 minutes in and Im ready to go back to my normal title, but this is a fun and unique game. Show ur friends and laugh when they fall over.
4. Dont whip ur cat.
 
Leeco

√âvaluation publi√©e le 15 octobre 2021
90 minutes in and I can already tell that this is currently one of the best uses of room scale so far. Really, really cool use of space and redirection and moving platforms to make you really lose track of where you are in the real world. The only other VR game that I think comes close to this so far would be Tea For God, and I think at the moment this might surpass that experience.

Edit: Finished it! Definitely a fun experience that I am excited to share with friends in the future. A great way to experience VR if you have the required 2 meter x 2 meter space available.
 
Giovanni0109

I've been waiting with baited breath for this game to launch. This game offers incredible scale to explore in a unique way. I'm impressed by the content I've seen so far. Hoping to get in a few play sessions soon. Will update as I can, but the game has no bugs/issues and performs great.

If you want a first person adventure, this is the game for you. Just make sure you have 2mx2m space!

√âvaluation publi√©e le 14 octobre 2021
Produit re√ßu gratuitement

This is hands down one of my favorite if not actually my favorite VR experience out there.

The concept of the game allows you to do something unique in VR in that it lets you explore a vast temple without any artificial locomotion at all. You only move in your room but the clever design lets you maneuver the entire temple.

Combine that with clever puzzles, simple but satisfying graphics and an immensely satisfying whip and you get a great game. Give the demo a try and then get back to buy this game.
 
Kexikus

√âvaluation publi√©e le 14 octobre 2021
It's on sale though worth the full price! Buy it, try it, don't deny it. I played the demo, loved it! Excited to play the full game now. Very interesting travel mechanics similar to how the fictional "holodeck" was described where you get the illusion of traversing a large space by turning and allowing the blocks to move you. This in addition to actually having to move to the blocks and "walk" the logs, it is one of the most immersive games I've tried. Played on Vive Pro with Index controllers and base stations.
 
dav124

1 personne a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
8.5 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 14 octobre 2021
Produit re√ßu gratuitement

In the past 7 years or so that I've been regularly using virtual reality headsets, I've had the opportunity to experience a bunch of great content and Eye of the Temple stands near or at the top of the best experiences that I've had.

I was given the opportunity to playtest Eye of the Temple back in 2020 and even though my living space is pretty small, I shoved everything I possibly could out of the way and barely made the nine steps required fit. In the game, you move forward, backward and to the center, left and right but only really one step in each direction based on the marvelous mechanic of standing on rolling tumblers or sliding blocks that keep you contained within that nine step boundary but also genuinely immersed within the temple game world.

Having a game with fully physical locomotion should be commonplace by now in VR, but Eye of the Temple is one of the rare games that takes advantage of your full room and puts you fully into the game world.

Armed with only a whip and a torch, you have to navigate perilous paths through and around a massive temple. You work to solve puzzles and defeat scarab enemies and booby traps along the way. There are shrines throughout the game that allow you to learn more of the narrated story of the temple's past. The entire game is quite well constructed and made me feel like I was on my very own Indiana Jones style adventure.

In my opinion, Eye of the Temple is a must have for any VR enthusiast and if you need to push the couch out to get more space, it is well worth it!
 
shelleproductions
1,334 produits enregistr√©s
0
3 personnes ont trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
6.3 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 14 octobre 2021
Produit re√ßu gratuitement

Eye of the Temple ABSOLUTELY takes vr immersion to a new level. The unique style of having infinite room to move around due to the shifting blocks makes the game feel incredible to play. Half of the time I forget I have a headset attached to my face with a wire to my computer with how much I was walking around.
The gameplay is unlike I have seen on any other vr game. It really makes me feel like I am indiana jones, exloring the unknown mysteries of an unknown place. The thrills and surprises of each section make me wanting more of this game.
The graphics are gorgeous, and even my dinky little laptop that I used to test on half of the time was able to run the game smoothly (though with a high-powered desktop the game certainly is better).
I'm so happy to have found this game because I do not think there is anything like it on the market, vr or not vr. It is a fun experience with plenty of opportunities to prove yourself to be the best explorer (speedrunning the game is incredibly fun).

The only "warning" I would give for the game is that you probably want to have your "VR legs" prior to trying this game. Walking around so much on the moving platforms can be quite tricky if you are not used to it already. That being said, throwing my friend into the game for his first time in vr was quite the show for me, and a fun time for him.
 
12problems

This is a great game and it's impressive that it was developed by a single developer, the game takes good advantage of room scale and has a good sense of immersion. The game also looks great in mixed reality since the player has to move around instead of standing still. The platforms and puzzle are interesting enough to keep you going for more.

Produit re√ßu gratuitement

Some hot stuff here utilizes room scale VR to the fullest, and feels like you are invading a temple and breaking priceless artifacts to grab gems and screaming it belongs in a museum. The only down side is that they are not kidding about the room required.

That space is your only method of locomotion, which is unique for a VR adventure.

As a bonus, this also has the smoothest LIV Integration to date.
